Comments.Message:
Hey Matt,

Sorry for the issue. 

Right now, only Chirp.config files update when a dependent file is changed. So, as a workaround, you could choose to mash all of your files via a chirp.config file. Then, whenever you update any dependency, the mashed file will also be updated. Granted, that might not be ideal, as you'll lose the interfile Less transformation that you get with the @import call.

I'm voting the issue up, as I do think that we should add:

a. less file updates based on changes to imported files
b. optional file recreation upon project build

Let me know whatcha think. If you're up for adding either of the features to Chirpy, I'd love to have your help!

Cheers,
Evan

Thanks for the quick response.  I don't think the css mashing will work because the less files are dependent on functions/classes/vars in other less files.  But good try.  Build seems like it would be easier to implement and an ok workaround until imports can be traced.

BTW ... chirpy's a great tool. Thanks for building it.

Ah, you got me there.  :)

So, yes, definitely a feature we need to add in the next go-round.

Thanks for the feedback!
Chirpy is awesome...so far this is the only issue I would love to see fixed.
